publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2055 Iain Smith: Byre Theatre—That the Parliament congratulates the board of the Byre Theatre, St Andrews on the successful redevelopment of the theatre; commends the excellent facilities that the new theatre provides for the local community; congratulates the Byre Theatre on its opening production "Into the Woods"; wishes everyone involved in the Byre Theatre success, and encourages people to visit the new Byre Theatre, whether to see a production or to use its other facilities.
S1M-2055 Byre Theatre (lodged on 27 June 2001) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Margaret Smith*
S1M-2055 Byre Theatre (lodged on 27 June 2001) Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Brian Monteith*

S1M-2055 Iain Smith: Byre Theatre—That the Parliament congratulates the board of the Byre Theatre, St Andrews on the successful redevelopment of the theatre; commends the excellent facilities that the new theatre provides for the local community; congratulates the Byre Theatre’s opening production "Into the Woods"; wishes everyone involved in the Byre Theatre success, and encourages people to visit the new Byre Theatre, whether to see a production or to use its other facilities. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Margaret Smith, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Brian Monteith, Michael Russell
S1M-2055 Byre Theatre (lodged on 27 June 2001) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-2055 Iain Smith: Byre Theatre-That the Parliament congratulates the board of the Byre Theatre, St Andrews on the successful redevelopment of the theatre; commends the excellent facilities that the new theatre provides for the local community; congratulates the Byre Theatre's opening production "Into the Woods"; wishes everyone involved in the Byre Theatre success, and encourages people to visit the new Byre Theatre, whether to see a production or to use its other facilities. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Margaret Smith, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Brian Monteith, Michael Russell, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie*

S1M-2055 Iain Smith: Byre Theatre—That the Parliament congratulates the board of the Byre Theatre, St Andrews on the successful redevelopment of the theatre; commends the excellent facilities that the new theatre provides for the local community; congratulates the Byre Theatre’s opening production "Into the Woods"; wishes everyone involved in the Byre Theatre success, and encourages people to visit the new Byre Theatre, whether to see a production or to use its other facilities. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Margaret Smith, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Brian Monteith, Michael Russell, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie
S1M-2055 Byre Theatre (lodged on 27 June 2001) Mr Keith Raffan*
S1M-2055 Byre Theatre (lodged on 27 June 2001) Cathy Peattie*

S1M-2055 Iain Smith: Byre Theatre-That the Parliament congratulates the board of the Byre Theatre, St Andrews on the successful redevelopment of the theatre; commends the excellent facilities that the new theatre provides for the local community; congratulates the Byre Theatre's opening production "Into the Woods"; wishes everyone involved in the Byre Theatre success, and encourages people to visit the new Byre Theatre, whether to see a production or to use its other facilities. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Margaret Smith, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Brian Monteith, Michael Russell, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie, Mr Keith Raffan, Cathy Peattie
S1M-2055 Byre Theatre (lodged on 27 June 2001) Mr Jamie Stone*

S1M-2055 Iain Smith: Byre Theatre-That the Parliament congratulates the board of the Byre Theatre, St Andrews on the successful redevelopment of the theatre; commends the excellent facilities that the new theatre provides for the local community; congratulates the Byre Theatre's opening production "Into the Woods"; wishes everyone involved in the Byre Theatre success, and encourages people to visit the new Byre Theatre, whether to see a production or to use its other facilities. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Margaret Smith, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Brian Monteith, Michael Russell, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie, Mr Keith Raffan, Cathy Peattie, Mr Jamie Stone
